intro: Gynoxys tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima gynoxys, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
